edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Splash

  • java.lang.Object
    • ScreenAdapter
      • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Splash

  • public class Splash
extends ScreenAdapter
    The splash screen is the first thing the user sees when playing the game. It has buttons for playing, getting help, and quitting. It is configured through a SplashConfiguration object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispose()
      When this scene goes away, make sure the music gets turned off
      static void drawHelpButton(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Describe the coordinates of the Help button, so that clicks to the correct region of the splash screen will cause the first help scene to be drawn
      static void drawMuteButton(int x, int y, int width, int height, java.lang.String onImg, java.lang.String offImg)
      Draw a mute button on the screen, for controlling whether sounds play or not
      static void drawPlayButton(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Describe the coordinates of the Play button, so that clicks to the correct region of the splash screen will cause the chooser to be drawn or the only level of the game to start playing
      static void drawQuitButton(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Describe the coordinates of the Quit button, so that clicks to the correct region of the splash screen will cause the app to terminate

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        Draw the splash screen
        Parameters:
        delta - time since the screen was last displayed

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        When this scene goes away, make sure the music gets turned off

      • hide

        public void hide()
        When this scene goes away, make sure the music gets turned off

      • drawPlayButton

        public static void drawPlayButton(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Describe the coordinates of the Play button, so that clicks to the correct region of the splash screen will cause the chooser to be drawn or the only level of the game to start playing
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner of the button, in pixels
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner of the button, in pixels
        width - The width of the button, in pixels
        height - The height of the button, in pixels

      • drawHelpButton

        public static void drawHelpButton(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Describe the coordinates of the Help button, so that clicks to the correct region of the splash screen will cause the first help scene to be drawn
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner of the button, in pixels
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner of the button, in pixels
        width - The width of the button, in pixels
        height - The height of the button, in pixels

      • drawQuitButton

        public static void drawQuitButton(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Describe the coordinates of the Quit button, so that clicks to the correct region of the splash screen will cause the app to terminate
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner of the button, in pixels
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner of the button, in pixels
        width - The width of the button, in pixels
        height - The height of the button, in pixels

      • setMusic

        public static void setMusic(java.lang.String soundName)
        Configure the music to play when the splash screen is showing
        Parameters:
        soundName - The music file name. Be sure that it is registered!

      • setBackground

        public static void setBackground(java.lang.String imgName)
        Configure the image to display as the background of the splash screen. It should include your game name and text regions for Play and Quit, as well as optional Help.
        Parameters:
        imgName - The image file name. Be sure that it is registered!

      • drawMuteButton

        public static void drawMuteButton(int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height,
                  java.lang.String onImg,
                  java.lang.String offImg)
        Draw a mute button on the screen, for controlling whether sounds play or not
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of bottom left corner
        y - Y coordinate of bottom left corner
        width - Width of the button
        height - Height of the button
        onImg - Image to display when the music is on
        offImg - Image to display when the music is off
